alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Nez Perce; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 9:29PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM PDT SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North and North Central Idaho, including the following counties, in North Idaho, Shoshone. In North Central Idaho, Lewis and Nez Perce. * WHEN...From 5 AM PDT Saturday through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, including on and near burn scars. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Several rounds of rain are expected in northern Idaho through Monday. By Monday afternoon, widespread 1 to 3 inch rainfall totals are anticipated. These rainfall totals may lead to localized flooding, especially in areas where heavier rainfall rates are observed. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
